required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: QuickFlex Micro Left Ventricular Lead Post Approval Study
clinical_study.official_title: QuickFlex® μ Model 1258T Left Heart Pacing Lead Post Approval Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this multicenter post-approval study is to evaluate the acute and chronic performance of the QuickFlex® μ 1258T left ventricular (LV) lead.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary endpoints of the study are:
- Freedom from LV lead-related complications at 5 years
- LV bipolar capture threshold of St. Jude Medical's QuickFlex®µ 1258T LV Lead measured at 0.5 ms at 5 years

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication
primary_outcome.description: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication at 5 years of follow-up. Per FDA, data from IDE subjects who did not consent to rollover into the post approval study at sites participating in the post approval study, were included in this analysis (see clinical investigational protocol).

primary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular Bipolar Pacing Capture Threshold
primary_outcome.description: Mean left ventricular bipolar pacing capture threshold measured at 0.5 ms pulse width at 5 years of follow-up

intervention.intervention_name: Implantation of a QuickFlex® μ Model 1258T LV Lead
intervention.description: Implantation of a QuickFlex® μ Model 1258T LV Pacing Lead

study_pop.textblock: Patients with an approved indication for implantation of a CRT-D system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have an approved indication per American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association/Heart Rhythm Society guidelines for implantation of a CRT-D system or participated in the QuickFlex® μ1258T (Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) study
- Have the ability to provide informed consent for study participation and be willing and able to comply with the prescribed follow-up tests and schedule of evaluations
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a hypersensitivity to a single 1.0mg dose of dexamethasone sodium phosphate or short term contact with heparin
- Have a life expectancy of less than 5 years due to any condition
- Be less than 18 years of age

facility.name: University Hospital - Univ. of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB)
Glendale Memorial Hospital and Medical Center
Kaiser Permanente Los Angeles Medical Center
University of California at San Diego (UCSD) Medical Center
Los Angeles Biomedical Research Institute at Harbor-UCLA
University of South Florida, Cardiovascular Services
Thoracic Cardio Healthcare Found. (aka Sparrow Research)
Wake Forest University Medical Center Clinical Sciences
Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania
Donald Guthrie Foundation for Education and Research

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Per the clinical investigation protocol, IDE subjects (n=54) who did not consent to roll over into the post approval study (PAS) at sites participating in the post approval study, were included in primary endpoint analyses. Since these subjects are not enrolled into the PAS, they are not reflected in the participant flow.

group.title: Subjects Implanted With a New QuickFlex μ Lead
group.description: Subjects implanted with a new QuickFlex μ lead and subjects previously enrolled in the QuickFlex μ IDE study were enrolled into the post-approval study. All successfully enrolled subjects were followed every six months for a period of five years.

group.title: Subjects Implanted With a New QuickFlex μ Lead
group.description: Subjects implanted with a new QuickFlex μ lead and subjects previously enrolled in the QuickFlex μ IDE study were enrolled into the post-approval study. All successfully enrolled subjects were followed every six months for a period of five years.

measure.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
measure.description: LVEF is percent of blood ejected from left ventricle

measure.title: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Classification at Baseline
measure.description: NYHA Functional Classification has 4 categories: Class I (least severe) - no limitation of physical activity Class II - slight limitation of physical activity Class III - marked limitation of physical activity Class IV (most severe) - unable to carry on any phyiscal activity without discomfort

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication
outcome.description: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication at 5 years of follow-up. Per FDA, data from IDE subjects who did not consent to rollover into the post approval study at sites participating in the post approval study, were included in this analysis (see clinical investigational protocol).
outcome.population: The analysis population for Primary Endpoint #1 includes newly enrolled and IDE rollover subjects with an attempted implant of the QuickFlex μ LV lead (n=1,930) and subjects from the IDE sites that agreed to participate in the post-approval study, but did not consent to rollover into the post-approval study (n=54), for a total of 1,984 subjects.

group.title: Subjects Implanted With a New QuickFlex μ Lead
group.description: Subjects implanted with a new QuickFlex μ lead and subjects previously enrolled in the QuickFlex μ Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) study were enrolled into the PAS study. All successfully enrolled subjects were followed every six months for a period of five years.

measure.title: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication
measure.description: Percent of Participants Alive and Without a Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication at 5 years of follow-up. Per FDA, data from IDE subjects who did not consent to rollover into the post approval study at sites participating in the post approval study, were included in this analysis (see clinical investigational protocol).
measure.population: The analysis population for Primary Endpoint #1 includes newly enrolled and IDE rollover subjects with an attempted implant of the QuickFlex μ LV lead (n=1,930) and subjects from the IDE sites that agreed to participate in the post-approval study, but did not consent to rollover into the post-approval study (n=54), for a total of 1,984 subjects.

outcome.title: Left Ventricular Bipolar Pacing Capture Threshold
outcome.description: Mean left ventricular bipolar pacing capture threshold measured at 0.5 ms pulse width at 5 years of follow-up
outcome.population: Subjects included in this analysis are only those who have left ventricular bipolar pacing capture threshold values reported a the 5-year visit. Of the 843 who completed the 5 year visit, only 774 had analzable data.

group.title: Subjects Implanted With a New QuickFlex μ Lead
group.description: Subjects implanted with a new QuickFlex μ lead and subjects previously enrolled in the QuickFlex μ Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) study were enrolled into the PAS study. All successfully enrolled subjects were followed every six months for a period of five years.

measure.title: Left Ventricular Bipolar Pacing Capture Threshold
measure.description: Mean left ventricular bipolar pacing capture threshold measured at 0.5 ms pulse width at 5 years of follow-up
measure.population: Subjects included in this analysis are only those who have left ventricular bipolar pacing capture threshold values reported a the 5-year visit. Of the 843 who completed the 5 year visit, only 774 had analzable data.

reported_events.time_frame: Complications and observations post implant through 5 years
reported_events.desc: Complications are considered serious adverse events. A complication is an event caused by or associated with the study device, system component(s) and/or procedure that requires invasive intervention (e.g. post-implant lead dislodgement requiring repositioning). An observation is an event caused by or associated with the study device, system component(s) and/or procedure that does not require invasive intervention (e.g. over-sensing or loss of pacing capture requiring reprogramming)

group.title: Subjects Implanted With a New QuickFlex μ Lead
group.description: Subjects implanted with a new QuickFlex μ lead and subjects previously enrolled in the QuickFlex μ Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) study were enrolled into the PAS study. All successfully enrolled subjects were followed every six months for a period of five years.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
